subject: Sales
title: Joe Girard: World's Greatest Salesman
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Joe Girard: World's Greatest Salesman.

hook.text: Joe Girard sold 13,001 cars in 15 years. A Guinness record that still stands decades later.

buildup.text: His secret wasn't charm or discounts. He mailed personal notes to every customer, every single month.

discovery.text: He believed in the Law of 250: every person knows 250 others. Each sale plants 250 future seeds.

twist.text: He was fired from his first dealership for selling too many cars. He made everyone else look bad.

climax.text: Girard proved that relentless follow-up and genuine care beat talent and location every time.

punchline.text: He sold more cars than anyone by never forgetting a name.
